title: How can I recover data from boot loop - Pixel XL and Nexus 6P - and then wipe them clean?
content:
Long time Android user, first time poster -

Yes, I'm aware that I'm using older models. I typically buy them refurbished and have never really had many problems, up until recently.

When my trusty Nexus 6P started having battery life problems, I got the next iteration, the Pixel XL.

Everything was fine until last week when the Pixel started boot-looping. Figured it was hardware related as I dropped it, but it worked fine for a couple of days after the drop.

I ordered myself a refurbished Pixel 2 XL and then popped my SIM card into the Nexus 6P so I could answer texts in the meantime - the Nexus 6P works, but just has to stay plugged in all the time.

The Nexus 6P has been sitting on my desk, plugged in. It worked just peachy for 2 days, then that started boot looping too - which tells me this might be app / software related and not hardware related.

The conspiracy theorist in me says that Google can somehow actively brick older phones so that I'll buy a new one...coincidentally the Android 11 update and Pixel 5 are coming out...guess that's a gripe for a different post, but thought I'd throw that out there.

What I'd like to know is the following:

#1 - Is there a way to recover any data from either of these phones? I believe the vast majority of my data gets cloud backup, but I think some of the unsaved pics in messages might be gone forever.

#2 - Once my Pixel 2 XL arrives, I'm going to dispose of both of these. Aside from physically destroying them, how can I wipe them clean of my data?

#3 - Can I avoid this happening in the future? Do I have to listen to my iPhone shaming friends and go to the Dark side?

Thank you,

Mark
